teal.render

Class Rendered

  • java.lang.Object
    • teal.core.AbstractElement
      • teal.render.Rendered
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, HasID, TElement, THasPropertyChange, HasBoundingArea, HasColor, HasDirection, HasFog, HasNode3D, HasPosition, HasRotation, IsMoveable, IsPickable, TAbstractRendered, TDrawable, TRendered
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Line, SimRendered, Sphere

    public class Rendered
extends AbstractElement
implements TRendered
    Provides basic support for any rendered object that may be represented in the Model's views.
    Author:
    Phil Bailey - Center for Educational Computing Initiatives / MIT
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • registerRenderFlag

        public void registerRenderFlag(int flag)
        checks if there is a node, if there is adds the render flag. This does not set the needsSpatial value this method should be called from within the nextSpatial() method call.
        Specified by:
        registerRenderFlag in interface TAbstractRendered

      • isReceivingFog

        public boolean isReceivingFog()
        returns whether or not this Rendered is receiving fog.
        Specified by:
        isReceivingFog in interface HasFog
        Specified by:
        isReceivingFog in interface TRendered
        Returns:
        true if receiving fog

      • setReceivingFog

        public void setReceivingFog(boolean fog)
        sets this Rendered to receive fog by adding its node to the scope of the fog node. Note that if you want fog to affect the entire scene, you need only call setFogEnabled(true) on the viewer, as the scope of the fog node defaults to the entire scene if no other nodes have been specifically added using this method.
        Parameters:
        fog -

        public void render()
        Description copied from interface: TDrawable
        The optimized commands required to update the objects vizualization, this expects the underlying visualization objects have been created and any calculations are complete. It may be restricted to methods that only operate in the rendering thread.

      • getRotationMatrix

        public javax.vecmath.Matrix3d getRotationMatrix()
        Returns the rotation matrix. If null, checks the quaternion and computes corresponding rotation matrix. Otherwise, returns the identity matrix.

      • setModelOffsetTransform

        public void setModelOffsetTransform(javax.media.j3d.Transform3D t)
        Description copied from interface: TRendered
        Sets the offset transform of the rendered model for this object. In the scenegraph, this transform sits below the Position transform for the object, and above the rendered node of the object.
        Specified by:
        setModelOffsetTransform in interface TRendered
        Parameters:
        t - new offset transform.

      • makeNode

        protected TNode3D makeNode()
        This method builds the rendered Node3D for this object. It should be overloaded by any sub-class that uses a custom Node3D (in other words, almost all of them).
        Returns:
        a reference to the created node.
